Justification: To assess for any visible abnormalities, such as asymmetry, deformities, or signs of respiratory distress.
To identify any areas of tenderness, crepitus, or abnormal masses that may indicate underlying pathology.
To evaluate for any abnormal heart sounds, murmurs, or signs of heart failure.
To check for any abnormal breath sounds, such as wheezing or crackles, which may indicate respiratory issues.
To evaluate circulation and check for any signs of peripheral vascular disease.

Physical Exam: Blood pressure measurement in both arms
Justification: To assess for any significant differences that may indicate vascular issues.
To rule out any referred pain from abdominal organs that may mimic cardiac pain.
To evaluate for signs of heart failure or fluid overload.

Physical Exam: Neurological examination of the upper extremities
Justification: To assess for any neurological deficits that may indicate a stroke or other neurological condition.
To check for diaphoresis or any signs of cyanosis that may indicate cardiovascular distress.
